data.content: It took @bepicolombo just 30 minutes to map Mercurys magnetic landscape as it sped past the planet during its #MercuryFlyby in 2023: a tantalising taste of what the mission will investigate when it arrives in orbit around the Solar Systems innermost planet. https://t.co/g9dlueBPXg

old_updates.data: Impulse Space wins $34.5 million contract for U.S. Space Force missions

data.content: The @SpaceApps Challenge is happening this weekend, and @Astro_Jenni is here to remind you!  Come put your creativity and talent to good use during the worlds largest global hackathon. You can still register: https://t.co/3mmntNvPqH https://t.co/cv3YzoqNHw

This week the Canadian Human Space Flight Program turns 40! Our "Space Eh!" playlist is perfect to get you in the mood to learn more about the human space missions our astronauts have participated in. Check it out:
https://t.co/fk10otGPxh https://t.co/Oa4SQFAoKc

Good morning/Goedemorgen! Our #ESAOpenDays at ESTEC kicked off this morning with the opening ceremony for the 'Open Day for people with a disability', introduced by ESA project astronaut John McFall, Head of ESTEC Dietmar Pilz and ESA Director General @AschbacherJosef. Welcome https://t.co/1qUVfAsLIr
And he's at the #ESAOpenDays at ESTEC tomorrow, if you're registered please come along and wish him happy birthday!

Today, we celebrate the 40th anniversary of the first Canadian in space! On October 5, 1984, Marc Garneau became the first CSA astronaut to fly to space, aboard Space Shuttle Challenger, for Mission STS-41G. https://t.co/l7dvQ5VEl9 https://t.co/6ztcn2wQpv

Its World Space Week!  Did you know that satellites help monitor environmental factors like ice melt, sea levels, and forest health from space? These observations are essential in tracking global changes to protect our planet. https://t.co/PCiIBwTZfP

#WorldSpaceWeek starts today! It takes place on the same dates every year  from October 4 to 10  but why? The answer lies in space history @astro_kutryk explains. During #WSW2024, the global space community focuses on climate change. https://t.co/wG0NIvxyoE

data.content: LIVE: Tracy Dyson of @NASA_Astronauts discusses her six-month mission supporting science and research on the @Space_Station, and answers questions from the media. https://t.co/QqHcYQLPzc
